predictions.text: Euro area HICP (headline, YoY, flash) for October 2025 will print between 2.1% and 2.5%, per Eurostat.
predictions.verification_criteria: Eurostat flash release for October 2025 lists the euro area HICP YoY (headline). Accept if the point estimate is within [2.1%, 2.5%], inclusive.
monitoring_signals: Country CPI flashes (DE, ES, FR, IT) preceding Eurostat release
Energy price moves (Brent, TTF) and base effects
PMIs input prices and supplier delivery times
Eurostat HICP weights and food price trackers
predictions.rationale: Energy and food base effects plus easing pipeline pressures point to a low-2s headline flash.

predictions.text: ISM Manufacturing Employment Index for October 2025 will print between 47.0 and 50.0.
predictions.verification_criteria: In ISM’s October 2025 Manufacturing Report on Business, the Employment subindex value is within [47.0, 50.0], inclusive.
monitoring_signals: Regional Fed manufacturing employment subindices
Challenger job-cut announcements in goods-producing sectors
Supplier delivery times and backlogs from PMIs
BLS manufacturing payrolls in upcoming Employment Situation
predictions.rationale: Manufacturing remains soft; firms are cautious on hiring amid uncertain demand.

predictions.text: U.S. Average Hourly Earnings (total private, YoY, SA) for October 2025 will print between 3.7% and 4.1% in the BLS Employment Situation release due 2025-11-07.
predictions.verification_criteria: BLS Employment Situation October 2025 table shows total private Average Hourly Earnings YoY in [3.7%, 4.1%], inclusive.
monitoring_signals: Atlanta Fed Wage Growth Tracker and Indeed Wage Tracker
NFIB compensation plans
ADP pay growth metrics
Unit labor costs and productivity trends
predictions.rationale: Wage growth is cooling but remains above pre-pandemic pace amid slower hiring.

predictions.text: U.S. CPI (headline, MoM, SA) for October 2025 will print between 0.0% and 0.2% in the BLS release due by mid-November.
predictions.verification_criteria: BLS CPI news release for October 2025 shows the seasonally adjusted headline CPI MoM in [0.0%, 0.2%], inclusive.
monitoring_signals: Gasoline prices (AAA) and energy futures into CPI reference period
Used car auction indices (Manheim)
Rent measures (ZORI, new-lease rent growth)
Airfares and hotel price trackers
predictions.rationale: Energy stabilizing and shelter disinflation should limit monthly headline gains.

predictions.text: Cboe Volatility Index (VIX) will close at or below 12.50 on at least one trading day by 2025-11-30 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Cboe official VIX historical data shows a daily close ≤ 12.50 on any UTC trading day through 2025-11-30.
monitoring_signals: Realized S&P 500 volatility and term structure flattening
Macro event calendar (CPI, jobs, central banks)
Shutdown resolution odds and earnings season progression
Credit spreads and MOVE index
predictions.rationale: If event risk recedes post–central bank week and earnings, volatility can compress.

predictions.text: ICE U.S. Dollar Index (DXY) will close at or above 107.00 on at least one trading day by 2025-11-30 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: ICE or widely used market data shows DXY daily close ≥ 107.00 on any UTC trading day through 2025-11-30.
monitoring_signals: U.S.-RoW rate differentials (UST vs Bunds/JGBs/BoE gilts)
U.S. data surprises (CPI, payrolls) vs euro area and Japan
Risk appetite and EM FX performance
Trade/tariff headlines and safe-haven flows
predictions.rationale: Higher U.S. yields and trade tensions can support additional dollar strength.

predictions.text: ICE Brent crude oil front-month futures will settle at or below $82.00 per barrel on at least one trading day by 2025-11-30 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: ICE settlement price for Brent front-month is ≤ $82.00 on any trading day through 2025-11-30.
monitoring_signals: Weekly EIA inventory/supply-demand balances
OPEC+/supply headlines and non-OPEC outages
Global PMIs and mobility indicators
Dollar strength and risk sentiment
predictions.rationale: Growth concerns and inventory builds could pressure Brent toward the low-80s.

predictions.text: U.S. initial jobless claims (seasonally adjusted, headline) will print at or below 205,000 in at least one weekly Department of Labor report by 2025-11-30.
predictions.verification_criteria: Any weekly UI claims news release through 2025-11-30 shows initial claims ≤ 205,000 for the headline SA series.
monitoring_signals: State-level initial claims filings and holiday distortions
Continuing claims trend and job openings
Challenger layoffs and business closures
Seasonal factors adjustments around holidays
predictions.rationale: Claims can dip episodically due to seasonals and still-tight pockets of labor demand.

predictions.text: ISM Services New Orders Index for October 2025 will print at or above 53.0.
predictions.verification_criteria: In ISM’s October 2025 Services Report on Business, the New Orders subindex is ≥ 53.0.
monitoring_signals: S&P Global U.S. services PMI new orders
High-frequency card spending and online sales trackers
NFIB services sector demand indicators
Corporate earnings commentary on bookings/backlogs
predictions.rationale: Services demand looks resilient; order pipelines remain positive despite goods softness.

predictions.text: At its early-November 2025 meeting, the Bank of England will leave Bank Rate unchanged.
predictions.verification_criteria: Bank of England Monetary Policy Summary for the November 2025 meeting shows no change in the Bank Rate vs prior setting.
monitoring_signals: UK CPI and wage growth prints
BoE MPC speeches and market-implied path (SONIA)
UK PMIs and retail sales
Sterling moves and gilt yields
predictions.rationale: Balancing decelerating inflation with growth risks argues for a hold.

predictions.text: Apple FY2025 Q4 Services revenue year-over-year growth will be between 10% and 14%, per the company’s earnings release.
predictions.verification_criteria: Apple’s official earnings release or 10-Q for FY2025 Q4 reports Services segment revenue YoY growth within [10%, 14%], inclusive.
monitoring_signals: App Store gross billings and in-app spend trackers
Subscription growth (Music, TV+, iCloud) proxies
Advertising industry prints (GOOGL/Meta) and gaming spend
FX impacts on reported growth
predictions.rationale: Subscriptions and app ecosystem tailwinds support double-digit Services growth.
